Aerosmith::Life's a journey, not a destination.
Albert Einstein::Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
Albert Einstein::Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.
Allen Ng::If you ask a stupid question, you'll get an answer, stupid.
Allen Ng::I hear the collapse of our civilization in the sounds heard at the grocery store, not in the screams of children, but in the silence of adults.
Allen Ng::It feels incredibly narrow and naive to think that everything in the universe that is observable is exactly matched by our ability to observe it.

American Indian Proverb::Listen or thy tongue will keep thee deaf.
Anne McCaffrey::[They] never discovered and eventually forgot to ask.
Aristotle::We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence then, is not an act, but a habit.
Astragarl Hornwood::Dragons?  Splendid things lad―so long as you only look at them in tapestries, or the masks worn at revels, or from about three realms off...

Ayn Rand::We are fast approaching the stage of the ultimate inversion: the stage where the government is free to do anything it pleases, while the citizens may act only by permission; which is the stage of the darkest periods of human history, the stage of rule by brute force.

Ayn Rand::When you see that trading is done, not by consent, but by compulsion - when you see that in order to produce, you need to obtain permission from men who produce nothing - when you see that money is flowing to those who deal, not in goods, but in favors - when you see that men get richer by graft and by pull than by work, and your laws don't protect you against them, but protect them against you - when you see corruption being rewarded and honesty becoming a self-sacrifice - you may know that your society is doomed.
Bob Marley::No woman, No cry.
Charlie Parker::Music is your own experience, your thoughts, your wisdom. If you don't live it, it won't come out of your horn.
Chinese Proverb::Teachers open the door, but you must enter by yourself.
Dave Butler::Silly is a state of Mind; Stupid is a way of Life.
David Hockney::Art has to move you and design does not, unless it's a good design for a bus.
George Bernard Shaw::Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.

George Carlin::Think for a moment about the concept of the flamethrower...it means that at some point, some person said to himself, 'Gee, I'd sure like to set those people on fire over there, but I'm way too far away to get the job done.  If only I had something that would throw flame on them.'
Georges Bidault::The weak have one weapon: the errors of those who they think are strong.
Hebrews 9:27a::It is appointed once for a man to die...
James Branch Cabell::Mundus Vult Decipi (The world wants to be deceived.)
Jennifer Walser::I put on my fluorescent orange ASSHOLE jersey, covered my face with egg, and walked out...
Johnathan Swift::When a true genius appears in the world, you may know him by this sign, that the dunces are all in confederacy against him.
John Stallworthy::They stand most straight who learn to walk beneath a weight.
Juvenal::If you've run out of luck, it doesn't matter how long your penis is.
Louie Armstrong when asked "What is jazz?"::If you have to ask, you'll never know.
Mark Twain::Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great.
R.A. Salvatore::If a person needs proof of a god's existence, then the very notion of spirituality is diminished into sensuality and we have reduced what is holy into what is logical.
R.A. Salvatore::I need no fantasies to belittle the great treasures that I already possess.
Richard Feynman::For a successful technology, reality must take precedence over public relations, for nature cannot be fooled.
Richard Feynman::Physics is like sex: sure, it may give some practical results, but that's not why we do it.
Scott Adams::If there are no stupid questions, then what kind of questions do stupid people ask?  Do they get smart just in time to ask questions?
The Eagles::Somtimes to keep it together you gotta leave it alone.

The Mentor::We've been spoon-fed baby food at school when we hungered for steak... the bits of meat that you did let slip through were pre-chewed and tasteless.  We've been dominated by sadists, or ignored by the apathetic.  The few that had something to teach found us willing pupils, but those few are like drops of water in the desert.

The Tyranny of the Diploma (Forbes Magazine)::Time was when a high school diploma was pretty good proof that the holder had received a basic education.  No more.  Too many high schools certify kids who can barely read or reckon, with the result that employers today want to see a college diploma as evidence of basic literacy.
unknown::Habit is the ballast that chains a dog to his vomit.
unknown::If you would ever like to go into a cave, I will take you. If you are curious about a dungeon, I'll find you a book on the subject.
unknown::'I think not!' retorted Descartes and promptly disappeared.
unknown::Light travels faster than sound, that's why some people seem bright until they talk.
unknown::The world is so fast that there are days when the person who says it can't be done is interrupted by the person who is doing it.
Van Ledbetter::There's a lot of times when you can't save money and save souls at the same time.
Walter Matthau::If you eat only celery and lettuce, you won't get sick.  I like celery and lettuce, but I like it with pickles, relish, corned beef, potatoes, peas.
Yogi Berra::If you don't know where you're going, you'll end up somewhere else.
Winston Churchill::The greatest argument against democracy is a five minute conversation with the average voter.
Thomas Jefferson::He who receives an idea from me receives it without lessening me, as he who lights his candle at mine receives light without darkening me.
Sam Levenson::It's so simple to be wise. Just think of something stupid to say and then don't say it.

Hunter S. Thompson::Life should not be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving safely in a pretty and well preserved body, but rather to skid in broadside in a cloud of smoke, thoroughly used up, totally worn out, and loudly proclaiming 'Wow! What a Ride!'
Gene Krantz::We were working on the ragged edge of all knowledge, all technology, and all experience...
Allen Ng::You can tell a lot about a person from the things you make up about them in your head.

Isaac Asimov::Anti-intellectualism has been a constant thread winding its way through our political and cultural life, nurtured by the false notion that democracy means that 'my ignorance is just as good as your knowledge.'
Allen Ng::Humor is in the eyeing of the beheld.
unknown::Give a man a fire and he'll be warm for a day.  Light a man on fire and he'll be warm for the rest of his life.
